There are other variations in the Valley that are also very good but Ted's has its own unique flavor and texture. Prices are fair and the ambiance is "old school." Don't expect to be waited on but the staff is always courteous. I like the all beef with mustard, onion and pickle. How much more "all American hot dog" can you get? Some places use gimmicks and bizarre hot dog creations to attract. You won't find those at Ted's. We enjoyed Ted's again this week and the reason I am not giving 5 stars is their onion rings seem to have become a bag full of little crunchy things lately. Years ago they were large, juicy rings with a tasty batter. Our recent experiences with them have been a little disappointing... too many little crunchies. We will continue to patronize when in the mood.

This is one of those places that are good because they simply been doing the same thing forever. The food isn't fancy. The toppings aren't new. The hot dogs are just done right.  Everything is inside from the tables to the grill have been in there since opening. The meat comes from Buffalo, NY and the grill is well seasoned from years of grilling. Thus making the best hot dog and brats in town.
The hot dogs just weren't that good.   Tasted like ones you get from the supermarket.  Wanted to like it, but really just bleh.

Its a hot dog place, I wish I could say more, but it was kinda disappointing for the price you pay. I had the all beef dog with mac & Chili and the half & talk "fries & onion rings." Its kinda like a classier gas station hot dog and toppings. The fries and onion rings are like crunchy fired particles and the dog was something I can do better at my own home. 

I'll save my money for something better next time I'm in the area.

Ted's is definitely one of my happy places. Deliciously made to order grilled hot dogs and burgers, delectable toppings, tasty sides, scrumptious milkshakes and loganberry soda. What more could a person ask for from a hot dog joint?! My only complaint is that their portions are so generous I can ever finish my meal in one sitting. De-lic-ious. If you appreciate a good hot dog and are looking for filling meal made with quality ingredients, Ted's is for you.
Good hotdog, nice diner. Great onion rings!

Hands down, some of the best hot dogs I've ever had.  

It always amazes me how awesome the grill master is there.  He gets your order well in advance so he can fire up the dogs with ample time to have it ready for you as you pay.  The selection of condiments is very diverse as well.  I always like to enjoy the delicious onion rings as well!

Really, you can't go wrong at Ted's.  The only thing that may seem to turn you away is the line can get long around lunchtime.  But, that line is very deceiving because they move along quickly.

Awesome! Charcoal grilled hot dogs of multiple sizes and varieties.
The line looks intimidating but moves pretty quickly. Be prepared because the grill guy will ask for your order pretty quickly so that they can get a jump start on prepping your dog/sausage.
My only complaint would be that the chili was lacking a bit of flavor and I should have asked for more onion, but those complaints would be nitpicking. 
Check this place out!
Very good char on the dog. 1/2 fries 1/2 onion strings, Chipotle ranch dipping sauce.
Ted's is worth the fat and calories. I do love the veggie hot dog and fresh onion rings are the best!
Everything was made fresh to order. The staff was incredibly friendly and the food was excellent! Great lunch spot.

Maybe it was an "off" night, but I just went here with my family and the experience leaves me wondering if I'll ever go back.  The prices are rather steep for what you get, most toppings cost extra and the food really isn't all that great.  

I didn't have a single "ring" in any of my onion rings, only small, overcooked pieces (looked nothing like the pictures others have posted).  The staff seemed bothered to help anyone and simply rushed people through the line, even though it wasn't particularly busy.  

The hotdogs were decent, but certainly nothing special.  I had a jumbo beef chili cheese dog and a pseudo-Chicago dog (everything but the sport peppers and poppy seed bun, because they don't offer them) myself.  I also tried the white and polish sausages that other family members were eating.  Truth be told, the sausages were the best of the bunch.  

The chili was a generic beef-only sauce and the liquid cheese was very plain.  The french fries arrived dry and unsalted, but not particularly crispy.  They tasted "ok" once they were doctored up, but these aren't the type of fries you "crave" later.  The shakes are very expensive for the small size you get and the chocolate shake tasted just like powdered chocolate milk, which I found disappointing.  The Loganberry shake, however, was very good.  

Unfortunately, for what you end up paying for a pair of hot dogs and a soda, I can go to much nicer eateries and have a higher quality meal that actually tastes great.

When it comes down to it, there are so many hot dog joints popping up all over the valley that it's quite easy to find somewhere better than Ted's.  The only thing they really have going for them is a recognizable name and a great location in the busy area of Tempe.  

Unless you have no other choice, I recommend you save your money and get your hot dog fix somewhere else.
Great bratwursts and hot dogs. Customizable. Made right in front of you in line. Great atmosphere. Good casual first date spot or to bring with you on a picnic!

it seems like someone read my review and took to heart the too thin onion rings...........

last time i went, i could actually pick them up and dip 'em in ketchup instead of them breaking in2 crumbles.
Just the best hotdog ever!  Try a footlong or a white hot!  French fries with malt vinegar!  Wash it all down with an ice cold loganberry!

Best hot dog you'll ever eat. Hands down. No argument.  Pumped they now take credit cards! The line goes fast, don't leave because there always is a line.  So worth it. Onion Rings are great. Ted never disappoints.

MmmmMMMhhh! Seriously good. Everything is made right in front of you with plenty of toppings to choose from. Delicious charbroiled styled dogs and crispy fries? Check. Another great place to try again? Check!

In the interest of full disclosure, I am a former Western New Yorker now living in Phoenix. There are certain "comfort" foods that I can not find here in Phoenix, good hot dogs, a good fish fry, Beef on 'Weck, thick crust pizza, Anderson's ice cream (people from the Buffalo area know exactly what I am talking about).
About 12 years, the COO of the company I managed took me out to lunch for my birthday. I did a double take when he pulled into Ted's. It was like I was home!
To be able to eat a Ted's dog  slightly charred and covered with their famous hot sauce was just like reliving my time spent in Buffalo, where most Saturday's lunch was stopping at one of the many Ted's in the area. To taste the flavor of that Sahlen's hot dog was food heaven. 
That was 12 years ago, and Ted's is always a go to place for lunch. My wife even will say, "let's go to Ted's, I want a char grilled dog". I have tasted all their various kinds of dogs and sausages and they are all excellent quality and flavor.There is something special about a dog cooked over charcoal. However, I have never had a hamburger there. If I want a burger, I will go to a burger joint.
Enjoy Ted's fellow foodies! I have been eating at Ted's here in Tempe for 12 years on a regular basis and have never been disappointed. Once you bite into a Ted's hot dog and get that slight "snap", you know you are about to eat a excellent quality tasting hot dog.

I live super close to Ted's, and have been wanting to try it since forever because of the high ratings from Yelp and people I know. Unfortunately, it did not even come close to my high expectations. 

Maybe it's because I'm not a fan of having my hot dog burnt, which I guess is what char-grilled means. Which I was unaware of how they usually cooked their hot dogs. My mistake.

The dude behind the counter grillin it up was really nice, which is why I gave it two stars. However, the wait was excruciating long for the food to taste as bad as it did. I ordered a Mac and cheese dog to go with a side of fries. I almost forgot I ordered fries because they really lacked uniqueness to me. And the dog just took over my thoughts anyway. 

So it was burnt. Like I said. I had to peel off the black skin around the dog for it to be edible. Then, since I got my dog to go, by the time I got home (literally 2 minutes later) my bun was all soggy from the Mac and cheese. As a suggestion, if they order it to go maybe just put it on the side and let them put it on. 

The Mac and cheese was also disappointing. I'm thinking I'm getting some actual cooked pasta, when really it tasted like easy mac. I'm a Mac and cheese lover and that was just so sad to me. 

I'm really sorry that I had to write this review because I just heard amazing things about this place. Maybe it was just my experience but yeah, I won't be going there ever again.

Been coming here since 1987!  Beat quality hot dogs around.  Don't be scared by the wait it's always worth it.  The onion rings are huge and crispy.  Even thought it's a popular location the prices are low and fair.  Don't forget a shake!!!

Ted's is a Buffalo institution and Tempe is very lucky to have the only out of Western New York location.  Everything is good.  I have a friend who always orders burgers and he is happy as can be (though he orders doubles because the patties are old school small and adds hot sauce).  I always order dogs.  If you want to order like a pro you could do this... wait in line , when the person grilling makes eye contact with you speak clearly your order.  If you want my advice order this way... "2 regular dogs and rings", you will then be shuffled down the line.  When they ask you how you want your 2 regular dogs I suggest this.... One with hot sauce, onions, chili and cheese, and one with hot sauce, mustard, onions, and pickle.  That is the way I have done it since I was a little kid,  This place is 5 star.

With a line already at the door, one knows Ted's serves up some mighty yummy dogs. In addition, their "white hots" are fab, as well as their burgers. 
I'm not keen on their fries or onion rings, but that is just my personal taste...they are both fresh and the rings are home made.
The flavor of Ted's hotdogs are unmatched. 
Go!

Great place to have a Buffalo NY style hot dog. I love this place and it is close to work. Fun atmosphere with old timey music playing inside. You will often see Spiro (now deceased) who is the descendant of the famous Ted in there talking with a bunch of typical regulars.

I usually get a couple of the All Beef Jumbo Dogs flown in from NY with whatever I want on them with a side of melted cheese and some pickle spears. The chili is pretty good also. You can pick from a large array of items to put on your wiener or burger. They cook it right in front of you while you wait. You can smell the tasty aroma of the mesquite charcoal in the parking lot before you enter. Onion rings made from scratch. They have footlongs, brats, polish, white hots (which I call bockwurst) and more. Some of them made here locally at one of my favorite sausage places in central Phoenix. They also have tasty hamburgers and chicken along with homemade ice cream shakes. 

Gets really busy with a long line during peak lunch hours. Get there before 11am or after 1pm. Poke me with a fork I'm done!

Well..... I got chili and it was disgusting. It was full of grease. Like a 1/2 inch worth. How nasty. I am sitting here regretting eating it.. I need to work out now and have a glass of red wine. Ugh. The hot dog my man had was nothing great. Costco hot dogs are better and CHEAPER.

It's too good, I love being able to build my hot dog or burger exactly how I want it. Great fries. Great service. It's all killer. Sometimes the line can get long, but that's because it's good and they care about each customer. Get the cheese sauce, dip everything in it.

i can't believe it took me so long to finally try Ted's.

pretty straightforward hot dogs, i got a regular hot dog with a side of cheez (not CHEESE, because it was liquefied and nuclear orange) and a side of chili. i thought it was pretty good, the chili was a little oily, but fairly tasty.  the cheez could have come from circle k for all i know, it was REALLY thick though. like my spoon stood up in it thick.

the fries and onion rings are pretty darn tasty too. i didn't ask for ranch, i'm not sure if they have it. i'm going back, so i'll find out!

hit the spot!

I was underwhelmed.  I liked the charcoal grilled taste to the dog but I've had a much better dog than Ted's.  Nathan's for instance is a superior hotdog.  I really wanted to like this place but everything was just okay, not good, not great.
My husband and kids really liked this place. The hot dogs and chili cheese fries are great!
Best foot long hot dogs in the world!!!
Awesome food and people. Every time we go there we have a good experience. Try the hamburger you wont be disappointed. Doesn't look like much but it taste awesome!

So happy they reopened from their renovation. My husband and I have been craving their chili cheese dog and corn dogs. The best part is none of their recipes have changed. They currently have some IKEA furniture until they get booths said a worker. Some of the finishing touches were done messy. As a designer I notice those small details. Over all the best hotdogs!

I get the appeal of eating a good old American hot dog at a historical place, but besides that little bit of nostalgia I just wasn't impressed. I mean a hot dog can only be so good. 

Don't get me wrong, I would lie in front of a moving vehicle for a juicy tasty Chicago style hot dog. But just not from Teds... the whole experience was just mediocre and there is always a long wait.

I have always had an excellent lunch at Ted's - not necessarily the healthiest - but excellent!  It is easy to be intimidated in front of the lunch crowd when the cook is asking for your order across a line of hungry patrons - but it keeps the line rolling, and you get your food fast (without it quite being such fast food!).  All the dogs I've had there were excellent (never tried anything else - why would I - it's Ted's HOT DOGS!).

This will remain a local mystery to me. A predictably long line, followed by very friendly customer service, followed by average or below average hot dog joint fodder. Onion rings are so greezy they are inedible. Just because it's the only hot dog game in town, does that mean you need to go? Nah.

True New York taste! They have crispy delicious french fries and thin crispy onion rings. The Salens hotdogs that they use are very high quality and truly delicious! Best hot dogs that I've ever had! Also the Teds brand hot sauce deserves a special mention, its very tasty tangy and has just the right amount of spiciness to it and it's very complimentary to all of their menu items... A++++++ Teds!
Teds hotdogs made me achieve my first oral orgasm!  ...."nothing could be fined than to be in Teds flaming pit right now"

This place is awesome! I get the Polish and the Italian sausage. They use a wood fire super hot and cook these in a few minutes.  It is a treat. Not a fan of their fries but lots of people like them. Try it you will like it.

Sheesh. What is it with people here? It's a [bleep] hot dog. Just a hot dog. Yet, time and time again, there's a line wrapped around the building five times over. I don't care if the best [bleep] hot dog in all of North [bleep] America: I get claustrophobic any time I'm in there. Isn't it time Ted stepped up to the 21st Century? It's like the place is run with all the professionalism of a kid's lemonade stand. Yeah, I get that everything's grilled to order, but if you're that hard up to be waiting for literally fifteen to twenty minutes for some footlong and relish, there's something seriously wrong with you. A previous Yelper wrote that "sometimes it's crowded"? SOMETIMES? Gee... ya think?

Went there on a Sunday 3 weeks ago to get hot dogs to go. I have come to expect a long slow line to order my food, usually 10 to 15 minutes, it irritates me , but I tolerate it.¬† On this day I waited¬† at least 35 minutes to order a couple hot dogs, that's not just poor service, that's complete total Disrespect by management toward their customers. As I got near front of line, I did see the manager poke his head out from the back of the restaurant , so I know the manager working that day. He didn't seem to concerned about the wait time, no sense of urgency. By the time¬† I got to the front of line I forgot to order the soda my wife wanted, because I was so completely pissed off about standing in line so long. I ordered a White Hot as usual, wife got a regular hot dog, the food was fine.¬† I understand they remodeled this place a couple years ago, what a wasted opportunity to re-design the ordering process. You know I can go to the Dutch Brothers over on Mill & Southern, It almost always has a line that snakes thru the parking lot.¬† Yet it only takes few minutes to get thru the line BECAUSE THERE IS SOMEONE WALKING CAR TO CAR TAKING ORDERS WITH A SMART PHONE DEVICE. You know Ted's, it wouldn't be that difficult have an employee with I-pad¬† taking orders, and maybe add a second toppings station, and another register to facilitate the ordering¬† process . A 35 - 40¬† minute wait, or even 10-15 minute wait , is to long of a wait to order a Hot dog, it speaks volumes about how little you care about your customers.

It's been about 4 or 5 years since i was last here. 
Every time I was in Phoenix area I would get lunch or dinner.
Stopped in a few nights ago and it was alittle sad.
The all beef hotdog was great but the regular hamburger was pretty disappointing. 
It was really tiny and thin. It barely got to the edge of the small bun. Thin a regular McDonalds hamburger. The difference is that Ted's was $3.00!!! Really disappointing. The split (1/2 fries 1/2 rings) were ok but the fries were not crisp.
Stick with the dogs or sausages you can find a much better burger in a lot of places.
Bummer.

I am a vegetarian and what better place than at a HOT DOG place to get food?  Anyway, for the price of my vegetarian processed tofu on a plain, grocery-store bun, I was expecting a bit more punch.  But what I got was something that I could've heated up in the microwave at home.  No flavor :-(  No punch.
This is a great staple of Tempe.  I try to stop by here before spring training and Diamondback games.  If you're looking for a grill dog I would say this is the place to go.

The wife and i make it a point to go to ted's dog at least once a month, more often if we didn't live so far away. Best hot dogs in the valley. Maybe it's the meat from Upstate New York or the mesquite charcoal they use or a combination of both but they are darn good. After they finish cooking them you can put pretty much put anything on them. Their fries and onion rings are also really good. The workers are friendly the place is clean and even though they may be busy, which is a lot the line goes quickly and you get your food fast. Just heard there are coming out to Gilbert in the fall. Guess we'll be eating there more often.

Had to give them some love, just eat here the other day, been there tons of times best dogs ever flame broiled you can burn em if you want... Chili and cheese are both great stuff. Only thing they always have a big line but that's tells you the place is a Tempe staple!

This is a great place to go if you're in the Tempe area and have a craving for a good hot dog. Make sure you're not in a rush when you come here because you do have a bit of a wait after placing your order but it's worth it. The grilled taste of the wiener sets this apart from hot dogs from other places. I also liked the onion rings a lot; they were very lightly battered and an order is quite generous - enough for two people.  Lots of seating, indoor and outdoor, and a very relaxed atmosphere.
First time trying teds. Only issue is no prices and no combos. So got burger with cheese which was really good. Will be back to try other things.

Geez!  I've been dreading this review for the last couple of hours.  If this is the last review you see from me, it is because I have upset someone and they have killed me.

Cash Only? WTF! The hot dogs are barely good (flinches, looks over shoulder).  YEAH I SAID IT!  Its not so much the food I have a problem with, its the staff and the hype.

I mean, I had a feeling it wouldn't live up to the hype.  How could it?  Its a hot dog joint that has the reputation of a 5 Star restaurant.  The dogs are good. Thats it, good.  The staff and functionality of the restaurant, however, was not. Plus, they charged me for an extra order of fries! Hey! My 20 month old can't eat two orders of fries!

I ate at Ted's for lunch on Sunday with my wife.  We both got the Jumbo All Beef dog with all the toppings (Catsup, Mustard, Onions, Relish, and a Pickle)... The problem was, while in line for only 5 minutes the staff managed to screw up 3 different orders.  That was like 40% screw up!  They were not apologetic, and the customers were getting irate!  This isn't the atmosphere I look for when eating lunch.  Irate customers and hasty cooks are not a good combo.  The onion rings were just a knot of messy fried mystery.  Don't get me wrong, I ate them!

Unfortunately, I can't give this place more than 3 stars.  And with this review I will be buying a handgun for protection.

I have been in Arizona for 8 years and have driven past many times. My girlfriend and I were driving on the 4th of July after watching some fireworks and she was craving a hot dog other then mine. The funny thing was we were stopped at a light and Ted's was right there so it was just fate. We went in and the place is a bit older but clean. We ordered a foot long chili dog and split, was a great eat and would recommend the place to anyone. If your girl wants a weiner other then yours then bring her there and watch her put that juicy piece of meat in her mouth, you won't be disappointed.
Best hot dog in the Valley! They charbroil your dog right in front of you, offer a variety of fresh condiments, and consistently have good crispy fries.

I really hope the seating is temporary. The chairs are uncomfortable. Very hot air when you wait in line. Seems like there is air in dining area. Friendly staff. I wasn't blown away....but it could be my but was numb from being squeazed in that folding chair. Really?

Love this place.

When I get that craving for a good charcoal grilled dog or burger I come straight here. Just can't resist at times. 

Plenty of hot dog choices
Wide variety of topping options
Fries and onion rings are made fresh with your order. 

Don't think; just go.

After passing by this location so many times I finally decided to give this hot dog place a try. So I tried the regular hot dog, cheese fries, and vanilla shake for my first time. The hot dog was just okay but felt that I could have made a better choice by picking something else. Cheese fries were decent and I did like how the cheese came in a separate container cup. The vanilla shake was one of the best shakes that I've had and I have gone through plenty of milkshakes over the years in my travels. I will definitely be coming back to get that again.

There's not too much of an atmosphere here as there is more emphasis on them serving customers and it can hard to find an available table when it's busy. However this seems like a great spot for take-out as the food is prepared rather quickly. This restaurant has been here for many years and it's easy to see why it has been around for so long.

In Short: Long lines, complicated menu, and a fist full of dollars ........ for a hot dog?

I guess I never bought into the whole gourmet hot dog fad, and probably never will.  I've heard my coworkers talk about the dogs, and on more than one occasion seen astronomical lines at the counter, so I thought why not, it had to be good, right?

Talk about sticker shock, and only for a single dog?  Very overpriced indeed, on top of that, they managed to complicate a simple hot dog.  Various types of meats and topping options were a bit confusing, not because there were too many choices, but because non of them were really explained.  A little annoying for a first timer customer.  The dogs themselves are not bad, but I think you'd have to a complete idiot to mess up a hot dog.  I still don't get whats so amazing about it, definitely way too overpriced, won't go again.  They can keep their wieners and shove it!

I grew up eating those Seitz hot dogs that came in the silver package and on sale you could get 4 packs for a dollar or something like that.  They were awful, and I'm pretty sure if I get any chronic or terminal illnesses, it's going to be from eating about a thousand of those.

Then I lived in Orlando for a few years and became a regular at Hot Dog Heaven.  Now THIS is a hot dog!  Then I started paying more attention.

Well, on Saturday Mr. M and I were on a hot dog cruise and stood in the very long line at Ted's to order 2 jumbos with cheese & mustard, mine also with relish, a bottle of water, and a chocolate shake.  The total was $15.55 and reminded me that I really need to remember to carry our own water with us.  That would have saved 2 bucks. 

Anyway, HEY, back to the dogs....chargrilled and perfect!  I was taken back to Hot Dog Heaven and we both thoroughly enjoyed our meal.  The milkshake was rich, chocolatey deliciousness too.  I will definitely get a craving for Ted's and can't wait to go back and try other items on the menu.

I was a little nervous when I saw the line but I figured if there were that many people waiting it must be worth it.  Luckily the line moved quickly.  The hot dog was pretty good but the Italian sausage was one of the best I've ever had.  The fries were just so-so.  The Italian sausage will probably bring me back a few more times.

Being a Seattle-native, I'd never even heard of Ted's until two Tempe natives mentioned this hot dog hot spot.

All of our food was prepared fast and it was quite delicious. Even though they're famous for their hot dogs, I opted for the corn dog (which was amazing). Personally, I think the best thing at Ted';s is their onion rings. I don't even like onions, but I ran across McClinktock Drive to get Ted's rings to bring back to another dining establishment.

Happy Hot Dog Adventures to you all!

The food is great. The onion rings and dogs are great. The ordering process is maddening. Especially if it is busy. Is it worth it? Yes. Will it feel worth it until you are at your table with your food? No.

Ted's has been around forever for two reasons. Great quality and fair price.

I coworker had posted photos earlier this year, spending hours in line to take her daughter to Pink's Hot Dogs in LA. I asked why wait in an insanely long line for Pink's, when she can get better product at Ted's. She'd never heard of Ted's, so I made it a mission to take her for lunch.
It was a super hungry day for me - I had an Italian Sausage with a side of a regular dog. The coworker had a jumbo dog, and we shared onion rings.
The onion rings were amazing. All onion rings should be Ted's onion rings! Thin sliced, crispy breading - clearly made fresh to order. 
My Italian Sausage was perfectly seasoned and had just the right level of spice. Topped with deli mustard and cooked peppers and onions. I could not have asked for a more delicious lunch.
In hindsight, I should have eaten the regular dog first. It was tasty. Incredibly enjoyable. But with the flavor of the Italian Sausage still on my tongue, it was a little on the boring side. Truly, nothing wrong with it at all - and had I reversed the order of consumption, I would have loved both equally. My fault, not Ted's!
If I had to come up with a con, it would be the location. Nowhere close to my house or stomping grounds, and too far from my office to make it a regular stop. Tempe people are soooo lucky!

If you want a GREAT hotdog, look no further!  I've been going to Ted's since I was a little kid.  I love their all-beef hotdogs and french fries dipped in cheese!  So good!  Sometimes the line gets long but it is so worth it!

Updated 9/13/17... 
Changed from 4 stars to three. Double cheese burger has thin patties; meat is ok. Water is not filtered... you do the math on that one. We just couldn't drink it or the ice cubes. Only one size on shakes. On the upside, they have remodeled since we were last hear. Great job on spiffing the place up.

Previous review:

Fabulous New York style hot dogs, brats, sausages, burgers, chicken sandwiches. They grill it right there in front of you and add all kinds of toppings. French fries rock.

4 stars because onion rings are incredibly greasy and comes in a big bag of gnarley pieces. Also, you can't fill your own soda or water or put on your own mustard and stuff. The young people running the counter aren't the most professional. Maybe that's kind of closer to how they would do it in NYC. 

Shakes are yummy - choices are chocolate, vanilla or strawberry. This beats Portillo's hot dogs down the street any day. Yea for Ted's!
Love, love, love these hot dogs! This place doesn't need a long review. GO THERE AND EAT A DOG.

Don't waste your time. Literally drove 30 minutes cause I heard great reviews & came for customer appreciation day. 91 cents a hot dog. The hot dogs taste like backyard grilled hot dogs, you literally can make them yourself. They also burnt some of the hot dogs.

The fries are okay.

In my opinion Costco has a better deal & they taste better.

Extremely frustrating to wait in like for 15-20 minutes only to have my order completely wrong. I ordered a veggie dog, which I've had before and IS vegetarian. All of the wait (really unnecessary there were 4-5 people working the grill and 2 people in line in front of me) just to come home and have a real hot dog that I'm unable to eat (I'm a vegetarian.) 

Not going to be coming back to Ted's.
Teds is awesome. The best onion rings ever.  There hot dogs are great and the service is so fast.

I'm not a huge hot dog fan, but when I want a hot dog, this is where I get a hot dog.  The all beef hot dog is to die for.  

It won't fill you up, unless you spend over $10, but it is a good, satisfying meal.  The toppings are great--they have everything.  Ketchup, mustard, deli mustard, relish, spicy relish, chopped onions, peppers and onions, tomatoes, sauerkraut.... Did I forget any?  Fries are good, and the onion rings are alright (although they are closer to an onion brick).  

Also, they do accept credit cards now.

I'm a Buffalo, NY native and the past two years we've come out to see the Buffalo Sabres play the Coyotes, we've stopped here. Bottom line, if you want a Hamburger you go to a place that specializes in hamburgers, if you want a hot dog, same story, Ted's is where it's at!  I cannot stand when hot dogs roll around a flat top in grease, or sit in hot water, charcoal is the way to go. Makes the skin super crispy and gives it the snap everyone should be looking for in a hot dog. I always get mine with ketchup, mustard, onions, and dill pickle. Skinny fries with malt vinegar and a side of cheese. If you haven't tried their loganberry, do it. Some say it tastes like flat Dr. Pepper, myself, I feel it's a cross between concord grape juice and fruit punch. Delicious!  I wish they would open one in Las Vegas, but until then, we'll keep visiting every time we're in town.

I've been coming here for about ten years and haven't been in at least a year. We visited today and I was completely floored with the amazing new remodel and same quality food. They have done amazing with the place and the food is better than ever. I was excited to hear about upcoming changes to the Tempe location patio and a new location opening on Gilbert road and Germann in the fall. I love the food, the people, and now the stellar atmosphere. My daughter was just as excited about her food and the new kids club they implemented. She loved the hat, sticker, and punch card for one free meal after five kids meals. What an amazing business all around! Major thumbs up for all the improvements.

Fine, fine, fine. Just get it out of your system now. Yell at me and tell me I don't know what I'm talking about....Sorry but I just can't rave about this place. Yes, its crowded but the line moves; yes, they yell across the room for your order and yes its cooked open fire style. You can throw any number of things on top. I'm still sorry but unless I am sitting at Yankee Stadium with a Nathan's hot dog on a perfect June day - which is all about the experience and the location - its still just a hot dog. 

Its fine. Just fine. Its a hot dog. With or without stuff.

I wish you were able to give half stars because this would be a 3.5 for sure.  It's nice that everything is made fresh to order.  The only downside of this is that it takes a little longer.  They also use the same utensils for the toppings (lettuce, onion, pickle, etc.) instead of one for each which I thought was a little strange.  It's definitely just personal preference but I don't like that.  

Prices are definitely reasonable for what you get.  My husband got a regular cheeseburger and a chili cheese dog, I got a bacon cheeseburger, my son got a kids meal, and we got onion rings to share.  My husband said the hot dog was perfectly grilled and juicy.  My son (who is very picky) also liked his and the amount of fries you get for the kids meal is massive.  My bacon was a tad overdone but my burger was PERFECT.  Love the taste of a nicely grilled burger like that.  The onion rings are thrown in  bag in bits so they aren't much to look at, but the taste is to die for.  

We ate inside and it was very clean.  I would go back again for sure.
Had the All Beef.  It was a really tasty hot dog.  To comment further would be ridiculous.
Hot Dogs are good but way over priced for a hot dog in my opinion.

Wow. I first ate at Ted's about 7 years ago and absolutely hated it, but I drove by this evening, thought about all of those positive reviews on Yelp, and decided to step inside. It was pretty damn good.

One thing though, if they're going to serve quality hot dogs and bratwursts, they should really offer something better than that yellow French's mustard to put on it. You don't drink a screw-cap wine when you have a good meal, and you shouldn't put that kiddie mustard on a good brat. This place will be strictly 'to go' orders for me, and I'll use the good German mustard in my fridge.

I'd been told by a couple of people that Ted's was the place in town for dogs.

Gotta say, compared to Portillos and Short Leash, I'm a Ted's man (with Portillos coming in second).

Got the white hot - loaded - fantastic!  
Split and onion ring order with my wife (should've brought the kids - huge order!)
Got a strawberry shake - the kid who made it said it would be the best shake I'd had - and he was pretty darned close to correct.  It was really really good!

If you haven't been to Ted's, get in the car and go.  Now.  Why are you still reading this?
Most fantastic dogs around. Always a long line though so plan to take your time. Totally worth the wait.

This is a classic dog place with consistently reliable and tasty food. If you are from out of town or looking for something different then every other place you eat make sure you visit Ted's! I have been going here for years and I never get tired of the food or experience.
Another classic from Buffalo NY! This is yet another reason to visit Buffalo, the food is incredible and the best part: NO CHAIN RESTAURANTS!

I read great reviews about this place and wanted to try it out for myself. I ordered the all beef hot dog and fries and was hoping for the best. Somehow the ketchup, mustard, pickle relish and tomato I asked for didn't get thru to the lady taking my order as my hot dog only had a million sliced tomatoes, ketchup and a pickle. Now don't get me wrong, the actual beef hot dog was AMAZING!! I love that it's char-grilled. It reminds me of a summer bbq, but the fries were terrible and because my hot dog order was slightly messed up I can't give this place high reviews. I'll stick to Lobby's for their delicious fries and CHICAGO STYLE hot dogs (which I love)... but if I'm in the mood for something char-grilled I'll definitely come to Teds again... though I'll watch them make my hot dog step by step so they don't mess it up.

Teds is the place for Dogs!
Love coming here at anytime of the day or night! Quick speedy service, and the Dogs are to die for!!! Priced just right for that quick pick me up as you head across town!
Service is always great!

What do you call a hot dog race?... Wiener takes all!

And so does Ted's Red Hots!  You really can't argue with their history.  They have been making hot dogs and sausages since the 20's in Buffalo, NY.  By some grace of god the made their way to Arizona and the rest is history.  This place must be on your AZ Favorite Food place.

Depending  upon what time you arrive you may have to endure standing in line in front of their grill where you will have to smell all the smells and simply salivate until you get your own.

No matter your meat choice, you will not be disappointed.  

PRO TIP:  Ask for a toasted bun, and you must try the hot sauce!

When it comes to fine hotdoggary, look no further.  UNIX has the philosophy of: "Do One Thing and Do It Well."  I guarantee you they stole that from Ted's as Ted's has been doing that since 1927, and UNIX only since '69.  They charcoal broil their dogs, which gives them an awesome flavour.  I have never been disappointed by a trip to Ted's, and I bet you won't be either.  They have plenty of parking, lots of seating, and several options and variations for you.  I brought my little nephew when they visited from out of town...he loved a place devoted to the hot dog.

Our first visit here, we came because of the great reviews and weren't disappointed. They have great music, throwback atmosphere was enjoyable and service was prompt and friendly. 

The burger was definitely better than your typical burger. It had a soft bun, and it was served nice and hot. You watch them make your burger and choose toppings as you go. The horseradish mustard was a definite plus!   Toppings were fresh. Bacon was cooked perfectly. 

Fries were good-shoe string style. Onion ring style isn't what we prefer but many enjoy the crumbly coating type - we prefer beer battered. 

Worth a visit if you're in the area.
Good hot dog for when you're craving one. They have tons of toppings, too, including mac & cheese and bacon. Good shakes, too.

Ted's is a Phoenix original by way of Buffalo and has probably fed tens of thousands ASU students and teachers over the years.

Ted's history is similar to that of other Hot Dog pioneers like Paul and Betty Pink, Nathan Handwerker, and Dick Portillo. All who started with just a Hot Dog cart, and grew their business into something very special. 

But Ted's is the immigrant story of Theodore Spiro Liaros, who came to the US from Greece at the turn of the last century.  

One of these days, someone will take the time to write the history of all the hard working Greeks who came here with just the shirt on their back, to start a restaurant or food business.

But I digress, because you come to Ted's to enjoy the charcoal grilled hot dogs and hamburgers and all the friendly conversation on line. Ahh, and those charcoals are white hot (see photo), which makes their food oh so delicious.  

They have Hot Dogs, Hamburgers, Brats, Italian Sausages, French Fries and home made beer batter like Onion Rings (photo), along with Milk Shakes and Malts.

Ted's is really just great food, served simply. I can highly recommend those afore mentioned All Beef Hot Dogs, Sausage and Onion Rings. All the tube steaks are $3.79 and you can take home some of their special bottled mustard for $5.39 as I did.

Enjoy!

First off, sorry friendly staff and I loved the old school vibe and decor complete with 1950's music. My family tried just about everything on the menu, I'd say In N Out burgers are better (and half the price) but Ted's had way better fries. The highlight for me were the milkshakes made with hard ice cream instead of soft, I had a loganberry shake and it was delicious. They also have gluten free buns and veggies dogs which my daughters said were great.

This place rocks! You will not regret coming here if you're a first timer. I love their corn dogs and chili cheese dogs with a jumbo hotdog which is all beef. Their coke products are on point too! Their lines can be long but it's because everyone knows how good this place is!

Ted's is the Bomb Susan! Find me a better corn dog or chili cheese dog in Arizona. The only place I've had a better corn dog is at Disneyland(That's right Disneyland Susans) Ted's has really good cheese and cheese fries. This place is serious!

This is my very first review and I can't say I feel bad for what I am about to write. I took everyones review hoping for a really good hotdog and onion rings like the reviews I read (best hot dog ever, amazing hotdog., etc) oh man were we disappointed.  I'd have to say I'd go to cocstco for a hotdog for $1.50 with a drink.

Five stars for the awesome dogs. I get the jumbo with mustard and onions and always enjoy it. Good hot dogs are hard to find. The fries are good and onion rings are on my bucket list the next time I am there with a friend to share the big order with. 

Deducting one star for the service. Sad to say but the girl who dressed my dog was obviously angry that she had to take over someone else's position on the line and she made no attempt to hide it. She gave the other worker a really nasty look and rolled her eyes at another employee. She slammed the buns down on the counter and was downright short tempered with all the customers. It was very unprofessional. She needs to learn to curb her emotions when serving the public.

UPDATE: Tried the onion rings today - they are great except for one thing - they should be sliced thicker. They are battered, not breaded, the way rings should be. Huge order.
great dogs, you name the fixins , good onion rings.
Gross highly expensive glob of fried onions.  Supposed to be onion rings.  Almost  $5 for this greasy mess.

I tried this place EVERYONE talks about..here in AZ... you hear "best toppings" the "Flavor" the "NY imported Hotdogs"...Puh-leez. I thought it was OK. That is all. 

I say you save ur money and go get a SONORAN HOT Dog  and then tell me about Flavor, Toppings and who needs imported hotdogs when you can make a normal hotdog a mexican deliciousness??? Shoot I'll make you a bomb Hotdog Myself!

Ayyy dios m√≠o...Not impressed.

Ted's has been a part of the fabric of Tempe for as long as I can remember. It has been the go to place for delicious hot dogs, fresh onion rings and hand made shakes. They also make great chicken sandwiches, burgers and even salads. Their hardwood charcoal grill makes everything smell and taste fantastic. They have a Chipotle-style ordering process so you can see things being cooked and assembled as you go down the line. The atmosphere is very chill, prices are fair and they have plenty of seating inside and outside.

Yum.

Haven't been here in, like, 20 years, but I can promise it won't take that long to go back. The dogs were perfect. I'm not a huge hot dog fan, but when I want one, I want one grilled and slightly charred. That's what I got.

The fries and onion strings were SO good. Hot and crispy and full of flavor. Not a lot of fancy anything, just your classic hot dog toppings, simple fries and onion rings (when you do it right you don't need to cover it up).

They also have burgers and shakes. Must try next time.
Other than their long lines (but we always go on Monday after a holiday, when everyone is off, so can't complain) their hot dogs are good. Definitely recommend. Wish they had a drive thru!

Good hot dogs and onion rings here. I'm not a huge fan of their regular dogs, but the all beef dogs are great. I get the chili cheese dogs and sauerkraut dogs, which definitely hit the spot. Prices aren't fantastic, the waiting line can get annoying if you are hungry, and there is nowhere to refill your drink...which are the cons. If you don't care about any of that, and just want some good hot dogs, then this is a great place.

Ted's offered me a wonderously greasy medley in my stomach that was tasty until the very last bite. 

Charred franks are my favorite way to enjoy them and Ted's didn't disappoint there. I ended up getting an all beef, a Polish and some onion rings (I had no idea how big an order of rings was). The links were grilled to near perfection and were quite juicy. As for the onion rings, they were greasy and sloppy and pretty much what most people would expect them to be. There is one downside though and that would be the lack of condiments. Don't get me wrong, there are a bunch but I was hoping for a lot more; there weren't even any grilled onions from what I saw. I had planned on getting my Polish Maxwell style, but alas, I could not. 

There are two final things I would have to say. First, the food and the prices were great, and the sausages were very good. And second, I can strongly recommend this place but if Lobby's right down the road decided to do some charred dogs, I think business could be booming. Check out both places!
Then very best hot dogs ever!! French fries and onion rings are incredible.  Quite th e bang for your buck. Love this place

Choice of dogs.  Hot dogs have the skin casing which I love.  Onion rings were great.  Quick, Cheap (two dogs for under 6 bucks out the door)  It was exactly what I was looking for.  Fast, yummy, fair priced lunch.
Love everything about Ted's, except for the lines but they really need to start giving peeps FREE REFILLS on their drinks! Enough said.

They really need to get more help! Only 4 people to work the line on a Sunday afternoon?!?  Waited almost 45 minutes before we even got to order. Where is the management?? I felt bad for the poor people who were working. They hustled but the quality was missing.  My regular wasn't as charred as normal. Great corn dog though.

OK, first things first.  To whoever even MENTIONED Pink's hotdogs in the same breath as Ted's, you are certifiably insane or you've never actually been to Pink's.  This is NOTHING like Pink's.  Pink's is like the Disneyland of hotdogs and has a wide selection of creative dogs that are worth standing in line for.  Ted's has a good solid hotdog, but definitely not worth any significant wait (which, fortunately, there was none when we went)  Mostly the options are: regular, footlong and all-beef.  Toppings were chili, cheese, ketchup, mustard (spicy and regular), onions, pickles and onions/peppers.They also have sausages (Italian, bratwurst, and others), but they weren't worth mentioning.  Definitely just get one of the hotdogs.  The buns were fresh, the onion rings are good (they're the thinly sliced, non-stiff kind) and my vanilla shake was pretty good.  But DEFINITELY not Pink's or anything amazing.  I thought Abu's review below was pretty harsh, but I hate to admit it, but he's closer to the mark than the 5 stars on here.

would be 5 stars but am limited on when I can go as the lines are always out the door, and sadly I am handicapped and standing in the line I can not do as they have no seating while waiting :( . 
The fact though that there is always a line there speaks volumes of how good their food is. I am not a big Hotdog fan myself but their  Hamburgers are excellent cooked over a mesquite wood grill YUM. If there is no line I will stop and grab a Onion Ring they are soooo good its a rare treat because as I said so busy normally, Just had some last week as I went by right as they opened and pulled in so fast I left rubber on the street. 
If you are looking for great Hotdogs, Hamburgers, Fries (get them with cheese) and Onion rings this is the place to stop long wait but so worth it.
If you are handicapped and can not stand to long go when they open it is worth it.

I don't know how I've missed out on this place for so long. Friends of mine have been going for years, and I don't eat hot dogs usually, but decided I would go and try their veggie dogs, which are measly in size to the real hot dogs, but whatever, I got two veggie dogs fully loaded polish style, and they were so. good. 

Also, their onion rings make me so happy. Not overly greasy, just plain good. Get yourself a lingonberry shake! It tastes like the best strawberry shake you've never made.

Veggie dogs (and also veggie burgers) tend to heavily depend of their toppings to be impressive, but once in a while you get one that is just right, with or without the toppings. 
Ted's hot dogs has a really great veggie dog, and all the topping choices make for a truly good veggie dog.

As a vegetarian, I clearly can't say much for their regular meat hot dogs, but I always get 1 or 2 of them served plain and without a bun for my dog (once in a while I let her get one with cheese)... and she loves them! I have people say my dog has a more advanced palette than they do, so I really do mean it as a compliment! 

My dog and I like your stuff, and Postmates delivers, so we will keep on ordering.

The place has a lot a variety in hot dogs, so if you wanna try something different than the usual meat and bun, it's a good place to start. If you are already pretty clever with grilling up you own, I think you may be a little disappointed. If you already buy good quality hotdogs, from the store, then the taste won't WOW you.
They have the best onion rings. I don't even like onion rings but I always order Ted's onion rings.

Great Onion rings too.

Yes, there si ALWAYS a line, but its hard to find a line that moves faster than Ted's.   They have it down to a science.  

Don't be afraid to try the white hot dogs.   An upstate NY favorite and not to be missed.

I've been eating here for quite some time. In fact, I used to work down the street a long time ago, and this is where I would lunch.

I had never been disappointed enough to review this place until recently. 

We had stopped coming for a very long time since Hotdogs aren't normally in our dietary preference. However, we were seriously enwrapped in Pokemon Go, and they had a Pokemon Gym in these premises. 

What a great way to enjoy a Hot Dog, and play our favorite game. We went on two consecutive occasions. Both were on a Sunday evening. Busy, but not too busy.

The first time around, the Hot Dog guy was efficient. The Onion Ring guy had a 'tude, and the cashier seemed like every customer was just a bother to her.

We both had the Hot Dogs. Mine was plain, and my wife's was the Chili Dog. We had our normal drinks, and I had a Strawberry Shake.

The Hot Dogs were just "meh" (in comparison to say, Short Leash), but everything else was okay. Nothing to write home about, and we even ignored the front desk help. We were too excited and engrossed in our Gym battles that we didn't pay much attention.

However, the next Sunday we went there. We got an even worse reception. The Hot Dog guy was on par again, but the cashier (it was a different girl, this time) was just too rude and impolite. And she forgot my wife's drink, and she threw an attitude when my wife asked for it, as if she was really being put out. I went up there and said something as I picked up the food, vowing to never to return to this establishment.

However, they left me a parting gift because the next morning, I basically heaved the Hot Dog that I ate, and everything else that came with it. I was literally sick all day, and had stomach issues for several days. And I have eaten foods in so many countries, that I don't normally react this way to bad food. Not sure if it was the Hot Dog, the Onion Rings, or the Milk Shake, but something from this place didn't agree with me to a great degree!

Hence, this will be our last visit to this Tempe icon. It has definitely fallen off our dining pedestal, and has fractured a leg!

Love Teds hotdogs! Love that you get to watch them make everything there on the grill in front of you. I usually always get the all beef hotdog and they let you pick what toppings you want at the end. The onion rings are great!
Great hotdog and good service.  Lots of condiments to choose.  It's a good place to get a quick lunch.

Thank god for Ted's Hot Dogs!  There is nothing better in life than a charbroiled hot dog with tasty onion rings and a soda.  My cohorts at work turned me onto Ted's and I kept it secret from my wife.  Yes, I'm that cruel.  Then one Sunday morning we were watching one of those Top 10 Hot Dog shows on the Food Network or Travel Channel.  She said to me, "I wish we could have a great hot dog today."  I broke down and wept, confessing my multiple sins of all the times I tip toed to Ted's to enjoy a chili footlong dog and an all beef dog with the works. She, loving me, immediately hit me a couple of times about the head, and said "Get dressed bitch - lunch is on you."  Now, if you ever meet Marie, you'll come to know that she is sweet and understanding, but on that day, I found one of her few limits.  Needless to say, we had a great experience at Ted's that Sunday.

REMEMBER:  They only take cash.  No debit cards, no credit cards, no bartering.

Ted's is legendary in the Tempe; and thankfully less than 2 miles from the Burger Guys house. And only another 2 miles from my favorite burger in the Valley, Detroit Coney Grill. I will say this... Ted's probably has the best hotdog in town. Try a jumbo all beef with bacon and mac and cheese on top! Ok enough of the hotdog talk, this is a Burger Guy review...

The Burger - 8.5 (out of 10)
Ted's makes a damn fine basic burger. When I think of a good ol' fashion classic burger, I think of the burger at Ted's. Ted's uses a charbroiler and they cook the meat right there in front of you while you wait in line. Great flavor on the loose packed thin beef patty (almost definitely chuck). Great bun to meat to cheese to veggie ratio. The Burger Guy gets the double cheese with bacon. Side note: the french fries are good here, as well as basically everything else on the menu. I don't know what's going on with Tempe but there are some awesome burger places in this town. 

Note: Score is for the burger only. Other factors such as service, price, and ambience are not considered.

Valley of the Sun Burger Tour

-Ted's Hotdogs
8.5
-Detroit Coney Grill
9

This place is an institution. I have been going here since I was a kid after Sun Devil or Suns games waaaay back in the 80's.  It's a comfort to see an establishment like this still exist, maintain reasonable prices and still deliver a quality product. Really, the hot dogs and burgers here are amazing and they make them right in front of you. Don't be shy - tell them how you want them cooked!  

This is your grill and it has been for decades. AMAZING

There's something about Ted's that makes it a winner. It's amazing that they have most of their locations in NY state and one in Tempe in Arizona, but I am glad that they do.

Grilled hot dogs, indoors, while you watch the guy cook them. There is a certain uniformity and process to it, but it also feels like a couple guys at a hot dog stand in front of a ballpark. I definitely recommend the cheese fries, they're a fantastic compliment to a hot dog.

With so many great hot dog choices in Tempe (Portillo's/Detroit Coney grill are two other solid options) Ted's definitely has their own niche. Always enjoy coming here.

There was a long line, so I was anticipating a good dog. What I got was a mediocre dog, very greasy onion rings that were nearly tasteless.
Not worth the cost or time.

AAAAMAZING.
They have the best hot dogs and corn dogs i have ever had.  It is definitely a place to try if you love hot dogs.
They have good fries, excellent onion rings.... and very very reasonable prices!  I have never met a single person who has said anything but incredible things about Ted's..... definitely a must try!

A hot dog, is a hot dog. Unless it's Ted's. 

Seriously there is black magic going on here. Apparently they start by getting a super high quality dog made for them back in Buffalo, then they beat the heck out of it above open flame! Seriously they poke and slice the dog up while it's being grilled over white oak charcoal and it picks up all that smokey goodness while cooking. 

There are two other shining stars at Teds. Their house hot sauce and the Loganberry drink. The loganberry is basically glorified koolaid, but man is it good. The hot sauce is more of a relish and is unlike any other I have had. I'm not really sure what's going on in it, but it's just a little spicy, sweet and awesome.

Their cheese is straight up east coast style cheese sauce. Basically cheese wiz. If you like that sort of thing go for it. The chili is that midwest no beans kind. Not my thing, but that's fine. I always get the jumbo all beef topped with mustard, relish, onions and the hot sauce. 

Everything not fried is cooked over that same white oak charcoal, so it all picks up that goodness. That means if you're not feeling a hotdog, everything else is going to be sold, but keep in mind "Hot Dog" is in the name of the place. Don't expect for their burger to change your world.

Last time I checked their were 8 locations. 7 in Buffalo, NY and this one.

This place was terrible from the second I walked in. I was so excited to get a good hotdog and onion rings since I heard that they were both excellent. First of all, the staff was the worst staff I've ever came encountered with. When my friend asked what to get, because we had never been there before, all the staff literally said I dont know. Nice way to upsell guys. Then the girl cashing us out coul dnt ring up our order right. I think she was new. The tables were small and sucked. All the tables weren't wiped down or clean. Now the food. The onion rings were TERRIBLE. basically no breading, stringy, tasteless. Mac and cheese tasted and looked old. Was terrible even when I added extra cheese sauce that I had to pay for. The chili dog I got was ok. Not very flavorful. Overall, I won't ever come back and should have just asked for my money back because I totally regret spending 20 bucks on 2 hot dogs, a sise of Mac and cheese, an onion ring and one drink. Fuck this place.

Great hot dog place. It is almost always packed, which is a good thing. I love their unique charcoal cooking method that they stoke right in front of you. It's affordable and excellent taste, includes all the fixins you'd want. It's hard to find a good dog place. Sometimes you have to settle for the Shcnitz if you aren't close Ted's. Love it!

UPDATE 7/10/2016:  While the food remains good, something has happened to the service. I have been going to this location for over 20 years and the line never moved as slowly as it did today. There were very few people in line when I walked in but it was quite a while before anyone asked for my order. Both the people in front of me and behind me in line commented they had also never seen the line move so slowly, and they were also long-time customers.

I tried to figure it out since I counted five staff members on the line; one on the grill, one handling drinks and shakes (which left her just standing there most of the time), one putting the condiments on the orders, one at the register, and one handling the fries and onion rings. The only thing I could think of was the staff was new. One person looked vaguely familiar but other than that I didn't recognize anyone, and another person said "I've never seen these people before." The employees weren't horsing around; everything just moved very, very slowly.

Because I drove in from so far away I hung in there until I got my order, but if I lived closer I would have been long gone.  I don't like downgrading my initial positive review but I think management needs to be aware they have a customer service issue--at least they had one today around 6:00-7:00 p.m.

......................................................................
Ted's in Tempe has been a favorite of mine since the early 90's.  Though currently residing in Queen Creek, it's worth the trip now and then for a delicious, charbroiled jumbo all beef dog.  So many places come and go, but it's great that Ted's has been at the same location for years. Hope they remain for a long, long time.

11/8/09: Found myself at Ted's again today [along with a few other times since posting this review].  Same great dogs, and this time got the fries and onion rings--so good. Same quick service too. So glad to see their business is booming during these less-than-great economic times. Long Live Ted's !!!

01/07/2014 - Ted's still delivers the goods. Since I live in San Tan Valley now (we formerly borrowed Queen Creek's name) I don't get out there often, though have been there a few times since the last update). Today I ordered the jumbo all beef, fries and onion rings, as always--and as always, it was delicious. Thanks Ted's!

OH GOD, oh god do I miss this place ;)
The burnt crackling skin falling off my dog, the crispy yum of the onion rings....now I know WHY i gained them 45 lbs when I lived here.

But oh how great it was.....I miss you Ted, I truly do!

Whole beef dog with everything...crusty, juicy, loaded, wow! The hot sauce here is just fiery enough to kick up the volume on that unbeatable dog. Would that I could've eaten four or five and still kept my girlish figure...

It doesn't take long to realize that there are a lot of Midwest transplants living in the valley. It's evident in all the Chicago based restaurants that have a presence to the Cubs fan base at spring training games... But who knew western New York was represented in the mix?

Buffalo to be specific. I don't know as much about the New York - Phoenix connection. But it's both quirky and cool to think that the only Ted's Hot Dogs outside of the state of New York, is in Tempe.

After hearing the ads on the radio forever, I finally visited Ted's for the first time about a year ago. Since then, I've also introduced my sons. And tonight, I was feeling like a kid with a craving for a good ole messy chili dog. As always, I wasn't disappointed.

I have previously enjoyed a variety of their hot dogs and the burger I tried was delicious too. I wanted something different so I chose a jumbo chili and cheese dog. The hot dogs are cooked over charcoal. 'Nuff said. I added chopped onion, mustard and extra chili. The cheese is a cheddar cheese sauce. Perfect for this messy kind of affair!

As always, I chose the excellent hand made onion rings. This side is best shared. They are cut thin and the portion is generous. Trust me, if you like onion rings, you won't be disappointed. Or feel like you got ripped off cause there was five rings in the bag. Finally, I chose the orange cream milkshake for my beverage/dessert. I don't think I've ever tried an orange shake before. It was delicious and refreshing.

Thankfully, Ted's isn't all about hot dogs. There is enough variety to bring me back. Next time, I'll be enjoying either the triple cheeseburger I saw being promoted, or a foot long, or one of their white hots. Thanks Ted's! Now I have to start acting my age again...

Had the Italian dog with bacon, strawberry shake and split (1/2 fries and onion rings). The dog was delicious and the bacon added just the perfect taste. 

The shake was watery and not much taste, although it was easy to drink through a straw.

Loved the idea if the split but onion rings were soggy. Stick with th he frys.

Make sure have time to wait if there is a line.

Overall for $14 I would say yes to the dog for sure and get some water.

We were going to eat at Beavers Choice but they were closed today. We decided to try Ted's Hot Dogs since so many people everywhere including the workplace rave about this place. Our order was taken and we got to the part were they top your order I noticed they put BBQ sauce on my no sauce chicken sandwich. I didn't want to hold up the long line to ask for a replacement.

THE MAIN REASON FOR THE ONE STAR RATING 

I tasted my iced tea and I am not certain what they filled my cup with? I didn't see bubbles for soda but it didn't taste like iced tea but the color was sort of dark. I asked my husband to taste it and he couldn't tell me what it was either. I think it might have been a mix of iced tea and diet soda syrup. I did NOT drink it and took a few sips of my husbands soda. If I can't trust them to give me iced tea that is a problem. 

The hot dog is extra fatty and greasy, the BBq chicken sandwich is overpowered with sauce and grizzle.
Also

The onion rings were a bag of greasy unseasoned crumbs with only a few pieces of onion. 


I know most people Love Ted's and they are most likely OK most of the time so give them a try!

Their claim to fame is charcoaled grilled hot dogs and burders, taken back to my days of youth when Dad would spend time at the grill.  They were great and it was even fun ordering and decorating my food.  The onion rings are fresh made and they give you a ton with your order.  The chili sauce was so so, everything else was great and it was a fun trip.
Geat food and fast service.  My son loves the shakes and we all love the food.  Great place to go before an ASU game.

The food here is great. I had a cheeseburger and it was fantastic. The employees however, seem fresh out of high school or still in high school and don't seem to really care. But it's whatever. The double cheeseburger is actually worth dealing with that. Just wish they had combo meals.

Great food, fries are much better than the onion rings. Hot dogs were delicious and tasty. Ranch were 3 for $1 so that was a good deal. Friendly staff and thankfully his time there wasn't a line so we ordered and had our food within 10 minutes

I've been going to Ted's for 10 years. It's the best grilled hotdog place in the Valley. The lines are always long, but they get you out surprisingly quickly. You can watch the grill person as the cooking is done. I love it! The buns are fresh, the dogs snap at you as you bite into them......heaven.

Ridiculously large portions of fries, awesome chocolate shake, hot dog had unimpressive liquid cheese, burger was okay, total bill $11.64 and we had food in under 10 minutes. Thumbs up, beats all the fast food chains.

If you are in the mood for a good hot dog then Ted's is a great choice.  It is cheap and friendly.  They also have a  great chicken sandwich and the french fries and onion rings are home made and to die for. So good. The only downside to this place is that ordering  can be a bit messy.  The cook hollars at you while you are still far back in the line and you have to yell your order at him and sometimes its crowded and hard to find a place to sit.  If you don't go at lunch rush though, its great.

I like this place because the food is cooked right in front of you, but I wasn't blown away by the flavors. My hot dog was pretty good and reminded me of days out at the baseball field. Unfortunately, I didn't feel well after eating here, so it's hard to give a good review.
Omg , I took a bite of a sausage sandwich  and I had to spit it out ... Almost puked in my mouth it tasted gross . Never again ....

Teds is just one of those spots that you love because it's simplicity. A hot dog and fries even without all the toppings is so delicious! Although my daughter and I prefer to get their yummy cheese sauce... We don't come here often but when we do it's always great. Don't be intimidated by the long line, especially during lunch, it moves quickly. My husband likes to get a root beer float which I'll admit I've stole some sips and it was good.
Wow, it's been years since I have been here. Decided to go all out and get a chili cheese dog and cheese fries. I had forgotten about how delicious these dogs are!

I wish this place wasn't so busy!  It is always packed!  If I didn't have to worry about things like cholesterol, or trans fat, I would eat here more often.  Great hot dogs, on a real grill with real hand dipped onion rings.

I used to love this place when I lived in AZ....the brats were amazing and even the burgers and curly fries were good.  Not too healthy, but then again, you don't think about that kind of stuff when you go to a hot dog restaurant.

Stopped in (for the first time) to curb a craving for a chili dog. 

This place is stuck in a time warp but that adds to it's charm as well as it's "flavor". You waiting line in front of the grill and tell them what you want off of their simple, easy menu. 
I ordered an all beef with chili and cheese and right before my eyes, I see him pull a fresh dog out and start to cook it over the hot coals. Pretty cool, I must say. 

One thing I have to give a shout out about, HOW CLEAN THE GRILL HOODS WERE!!! For being over open coals and with the volume of business they do (was busy when we were there), those hoods were sparkling CLEAN!! To keep hoods clean in any restaurant, you clean them like bi weekly... these things look like they are polished daily!!! great job!! 

Back to the dogs- The chili and cheese are added right in front of you, as well as a lot of other fix-ins (if you ask). Mine came out just the right temperature and the chili and cheese were awesome! chili was flavorful and tasty, not too spicy. Dog was juicy and the bun was soft but stable. We ordered onion rings (which were not traditional but really good) and some potato salad. I was not a fan of the potato salad (it was lacking in basic spices, as well as it needed more mustard to tang it up) but that's okay, I would still go back for the dogs and rings! 

Reasonably priced, a pretty quick place to grab a hot dog/bratwurst, just like from a family 4th of july bbq!

A long standing Tempe institution that proves that Hot Dogs can be eaten and even craved outside of ballparks.  A big plus to their onion rings.  A small minus for their boring out of a bag enriched buns.

Don't let the long line scare you, they're good at moving the customers through and with a friendly smile, to boot. They make fancy dogs and they're the huge diamondback dog style and thickness. They're pretty tasty. The only downside is maybe you'll pay a bit much for hello? a fancy hot dog. Their chocolate malt is this weird color of diarrhea, but again, don't let that fool you, because it's pretty cold and thick and tastes really good, but then, what's up with the off color? It's a shade you just wouldn't expect. When it's super busy, they run the risk of paper and junk on the floor but I saw an employee trying to keep up with picking it up. 

On one occasion I was stranded and nearly dehydrated (bad experience with the shitty bus system) and I was forced to take shelter here. They gave me water and nobody make a kink about having to purchase something while I waited for my husband to pick me up.

We stumbled upon this place on the way to another restaurant and I'm so glad we stopped. The shakes are creamy goodness!! The owner was grilling the dogs and each one has the crispy flame grilled taste. I got a white hot and all beef, both were fantastic. My Dad is from NY so it was too cool finding a place in Az that serves white hots. This is the perfect place if you're craving old school, made to order food.

If you are looking for a good fresh cooked hot dog, or sausage, this is the place to go! They cook the meat while you are waiting in line, which I thought was pretty cool. It was actually kind of intimidating at first, if you don't know what to do.
The sausage was good, although pleas note that 1 is more than enough!
The fries and onion rings are good too! 

If you're ever in the area and want a good hotdog or sausage, stop by Ted's!

Been here a few times before and all was well. Today's effort by the staff needed improvement. Forgot a corn dog for the guy in front of me, forgot the onion ring topper for one of my burger's so the burger sat getting cold and our hot dog getting cold. The girl putting the onion ring on the burger rushed the burger to the tray so the top roll fell on the dirty counter. No one apologized for that or the food getting cold. They also spilled the guy behind me's pickle from his hot dog on the counter.  Today's crew needs some re-training. Best part was the lady cleaning tables. She was very courteous.

A Really Good HotDog.

I have never been a big fan of hot dogs however, my nephew is so off to Teds we went.  The line at Ted's was long but moved quickly  ( don't let the length of people waiting in line be discouraging). As your waiting in line the  person on the grill will ask you what you would like to order, it's not really shouting but more of a long distance conversation. I actually found ordering that way to be kind of fun.

The hotdogs are shipped in from Buffalo, NY. The charbroiled hot dog have a great flavor and there are so many toppings to choose from. I had one with homemade chili, cheese and onions. It was fantastic. I especially liked the chili. I also ordered the onion rings and they were also very good so if you like hotdogs give Ted's a try.

Always very clean. All ingredients are of the highest quality. Although "hotdogs" are in the name, their burgers and chicken are also very good. As well as their shakes, fries and onion rings. The restaurant is also on the Tempe bike path. Fair prices, and military discounts are offered. The staff is very friendly, and the only downside is the wait. Avoid during lunch hours if you are in a hurry.

This is a darn good hot dog, ask them to grill your bun too. I would have given it 5 stars but the onion rings were limp and greasy, I'll try the fries next time. Save some of the chile sause on the side for the fries.

Every so often, a place reminds you of what true quality means. I get that to some people it's "just a dog" or "just a sausage" but to the yelper/foodies out there, TRUST AND BELIEVE THAT TED'S IS THE REAL DEAL.

I've been coming here since the 90's - White Hots, Italians, All Beefs, Brats, Chili Dawgs...whatever your pleasure, Reds will hook you up. 

Fries, onion rings, shakes - ALL also legit. 

If ya don't know, now y'know...

Friendly service and a funky throwback ambiance make this place a fun alternative to delicious food.  I love a good hot dog, but I'm not convinced that Ted's serves one.   Still, it may be worth a trip to bask in their quirky ambience... And who knows, maybe one of their Loganberry milkshakes.  

But, hotdogs, I'll cozy up to a Sonoran stand next time I have a craving.

We love Ted's and the great grilled pork hot dogs plus all there other items but a Ted's hot dog is the best.  Since moving west from upstate NY we are looking for a pork hot dog (not a sonoran but true all pork) like you find at Ted's.  We are in the Tucson area and we really wish a Ted's would open up here.  Does anyone know outside of Ted's where one can find a real pork hot dog in this region? The best we can do now is order from a website called buffalofood.com.  Appreciate any info.Thanks

Not a fan. Maybe I did not get the right thing. Who knows. I did NOT enjoy my Chicago-style hotdog, despite all of the reviews saying how good the dogs are here. 
My friend experienced the same thing. Granted, these "Chicago-style dogs" were not on the menu and had to be improvised, (which I am shocked they were not on the menu...) and they were also missing some key ingredients. 

It was an average to below average hot dog that I could have done better at home. I would take a Sonoran style hotdog or a Chicago dog from a little road/parking lot stand any day over these hotdogs. 


IMHO, check it out and see for yourself, or save your money and go elsewhere.

I thought this place was really good for what it is. I don't really understand all the awards and hype for it though... In the end it's just a hot dog to me. I enjoyed my regular hot dog with mustard, onions, sauerkraut, and a pickle. I have to say the real star of the meal was the onion rings! They were unfortunately very addicting. We got a strawberry milkshake as well and it was delicious.

Ted's is an homage to the Buffalo NY hot dog stand food from which this indie chain derives its roots.  I first started going to Ted's years ago in Tempe. I like their white hots , polish dog and regular dogs. Fries are great when they are hot. Shakes are excellent since they are made from ice cream on the spot. Make sure your fries are hot when you get them . Other than that, it's a great little hot dog stop. Toppings are gratis except chili cheese.

Tried a foot long with onion rings.  The hot dog was good, and a great value.  The onion rings were just ok, they were more like strings than rings.  Overall I see why this place stays so busy, it's good for a quick bite.

Show me a better hot dog in AZ!  I'm from Chicago and this is a good dog!  I can't get enough of the spicy relish. You have to try it!  The service is usually horrible, but that is something I've come to love about hot dog joints coming from Chicago.  Ted's is great and it's really inexpensive!  Oh and they finally accept debit/credit cards!

My first visit to Ted's. Went with a native of buffalo so was schooled on what to order and how to get the dog dressed.  Had the original footlong loaded with double hot sauce and it was the bomb. The homemade onion rings hit the spot too. I will definitely do this again and again and again.  I cant even imagine life without a visit to Ted's now.

Moved away from AZ 14 years ago so had to hit Ted's on a recent visit.  Not as thrilled any more.  Foot long hot dog was expertly cooked and tasted wonderful but overwhelmed by a too big bun.  Onion rings were superb until you got under the first layer and then they were like onion "pieces" and not fresh at all.  Chocolate shake excellent.  My biggest gripe is a twenty+ customer line being serviced by one guy on the grill and one guy fixing the hot dogs who was working at a snail's pace.  Nice memories but who knows if I'll be back.

I just got done moving my kid into ASU and remembered how my father had taken me to teds so many times as a child. We got down there and waited in the usual line but it smells so wonderful with the burgers and hotdogs on the grill. The wait was very short and actually took our order as we waited in line with the tablet. Hot dogs are still unbelievably great felt like I was a little kid again. The french fries were monstrous and quantity and I got the sweet and spicy sauce which is like a fry sauce on the side went perfect with them. My wife gave me some of her onion rings to share and they were equally as good. Before I end this review I've got to say their malts are the best I've ever had outside of New York City. Even the staff came by to ask if they could take our trays for us and we're so courteous as we're getting our meal. One of the best places we're eating that in a very long time get to know the more things change the more they stay the same
Awesome hot dog place. I love the grilled hot dogs and they have, hands down, the best onion rings!
Wonderful quality of food- just a bit pricey for the portions other than the foot-long hot dog (although I'd much prefer one of the more sausage like meats)
